circumstances: The aircraft was performing a flight from Indonesia (Jakarta and Cilacap) to Sydney on behalf of Qantas Airways, carrying 18 'refugees', women and children, escaping the war. En route, while cruising some 400 km south of Cilacap, the seaplane christened 'Circe' was shot down by the pilot of a Japanese bomber that was performing a maritime patrol flight from Denpasar. Out of control, the Empire Flying Boat crashed into the sea and was lost. All 22 occupants were killed.
probable_cause: Shot down by a Japanese bomber.
